commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh, Shioriko...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Good morning.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Morning... Um, Shioriko? I'm sorry about the other day.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I don't believe I am the person you should be apologizing to.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah... But it seems like Ayumu's been absent lately.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I see you have noticed this as well.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Huh?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Nothing. We will leave it at that. So, as the deadline is fast approaching, are your efforts to gather volunteers going smoothly?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Um, well...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You need not answer. In any case, I have no intention of going back on my word.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'm gonna try and persevere to the very end.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I wish you all the best.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Thanks. Well then...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Uh, thank you for your time.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Sigh*

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Sounds like it didn't go well.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah... What about you guys?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I've definitely conversed more competently...

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Same here...

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Me too.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: It's not just that we're not getting results. It feels like the more effort we put in, the worse the response is.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: You think so, too? I've actually been thinking the same thing myself.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I was thinking... Maybe the idea of asking for volunteers itself is the wrong way to go about it.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: What do you mean, Setsuna?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Shouldn't we be selling it like it's this really fun festival they can't miss out on?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Selling it...?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I getcha. You're saying our desperation is turning people off.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Hold up, I don't get it at all!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Like, it's the difference between opening up a cake bakery and asking people to come bake a bunch of cute and delicious cakes together...

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Versus begging people for help because your bakery will go out of business without them!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Which request would you accept, Kasukasu?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Obviously the first one! The second one makes it sound like you'll blame me if the bakery goes under! And hey! Don't call me Kasukasu!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: That's exactly what I'm saying, Kasumi. People will be more inclined to help if we invite them to join because it'll be fun.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: But if we beg them for help, they'll feel too anxious to agree.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I see. I get what you're saying now.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: You might be right about that.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: It's possible we've forgotten to tell people the most important thing—that the School Idol Festival is going to be incredibly fun.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: The School Idol Festival is fun! We can't forget that.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: That's right.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: It's like when you see someone all excited and hyped up over something, and you get curious and want to join in too if it's that much fun.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's exactly it. I completely glazed over all of that.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I should've asked everyone to help us create a fun event, but instead, all I could do was just simply ask for their help. It's only natural they didn't feel like joining...

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: It's normal that you felt under pressure, but that's got nothing to do with the people you're asking.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Maybe we needed to put ourselves in their shoes more.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Yeah... I'd probably be a little reluctant if I were asked like that too.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I wouldn't want to spend time on something that didn't sound fun either.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I was too eager to get results!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Same here, Ai. We should've realized sooner.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We know what we were doing wrong now, but are we too late?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Can we turn things around from here?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I don't know, but I wanna do everything in my power!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I'm gonna do what I can as well, but aren't we fighting a losing battle?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Yeah, we've only got a week left. If only we had another month!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: It pains me to say this, but it looks like this time...

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: This is so disappointing. Everyone was looking forward to it.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: But we all gave it our best shot.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Especially you. You worked yourself so hard we couldn't help but worry.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: No... It was all just wasted effort in the end. I'm so...so sorry.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Chin up. If you give up when you don't get the results you want, then you won't be able to achieve anything.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: The worst thing you can do is not attempt something because you're afraid of failure.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I agree. This hasn't been a waste of time or effort at all. I'm sure we can use what we've learned for next time.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: She's right. For us to fail after how hard we've worked this time round just means it was all bad timing! It'll work out next time!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Everyone's being so encouraging, but I really can't forgive myself for all of this!)
